pullRequest.title: install dependencies dev and prod environment
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description
Please include a summary of the feature or issue being fixed. Please also include relevant motivation and context. List any dependencies that are required for this change.
Fixes #(issue)
Type of change
Please delete options that are not relevant.

 Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
 New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
 Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
 This change requires a documentation update

Feature/Issue validation/testing
Please describe the tests [UT/IT] that you ran to verify your changes and relevent result summary. Provide instructions so it can be reproduced.
Please also list any relevant details for your test configuration.


 Test A


 Test B


UT/IT execution results


Logs


Checklist:

 Have you added tests that prove your fix is effective or that this feature works?
 New and existing unit tests pass locally with these changes?
 Has code been commented, particularly in hard-to-understand areas?
 Have you made corresponding changes to the documentation?

commit.message:
Merge branch 'build_fixes' of https://github.com/pytorch/serve into build_fixes1

# Conflicts:
#	README.md
#	ts_scripts/install_dependencies.py

Merge branch 'build_fixes' of https://github.com/pytorch/serve into build_fixes1

# Conflicts:
#	README.md
#	ts_scripts/install_dependencies.py

nodes.bodyText:
@maheshambule  Is there an analogous command for production environment for this step?
If not to reduce confusion please list the full sequence of steps of Dev and Prod as two separate subsections in the readme.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -48,9 +48,11 @@ NOTE At present, wheels for windows are not available on PyPi. However following
  - Start 'Anaconda Powershell Prompt' (APP) as Admin User i.e. By right click on APP and run following commands
  - `git clone https://github.com/pytorch/serve.git`
  - `pip install click`
- - `cd serve`
- - `python .\ts_scripts\install_dependencies.py`
- - `python .\ts_scripts\install_from_src.py`
+ - `cd serve`  
+ -  for development purposes, use command below:  
+   `python .\ts_scripts\install_dependencies.py --environment=dev`

nodes.bodyText: I had tested with Py37 on conda recently. Why are we adding Py38 as as a min?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -25,42 +25,37 @@ TorchServe is a flexible and easy to use tool for serving PyTorch models.
 
 ## Install TorchServe
 
-1. Install Java 11
+1. Install dependencies
 
-    For Ubuntu
-    ```bash
-    sudo apt-get install openjdk-11-jdk
-    ```
-   
-   For Mac
-    ```bash
-    brew tap AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk
-    brew cask install adoptopenjdk11
-    ```
-
-2. Install python pre-requisite packages
+Note: For Conda, Python 3.8 is required to run Torchserve.
